Subscribing to Newsgroups: By subscribing to a newsgroup, you can conveniently keep track of incoming messages within that particular group . Three methods of establishing or modifying your personal subscribe list are explained below.

The first method of subscribing is to view all
newsgroups available. The first time you view this list, there will be no boxes checked indicating there are no subscribed newsgroups. After your subscribe list has been established, the list will reflect your current subscribe choices with a check in the box beside those groups you have subscribed to. The list is expandable based on hierarchies. Those names in bold and ending with an asterisk (*) are hierarchies. 

To view the groups within a hierarchy, simply click the hierarchy name and you will be taken to a list of the groups and possible sub-hierarchies within that hierarchy. Group names that have a check box next to them are at the actual newsgroup level, and when you click on a group name it will take you directly to the messages within that newsgroup. 

By clicking the box next to a newsgroup name, you are indicating that you wish to subscribe to that particular newsgroup. If the box is already checked and you uncheck it, the group will be removed from your personal subscribe list once you press the "Save Settings" button located at the end of the page. Changes will not be recorded until you press the "Save Settings" button at the end of the page.

The second method is to view your current subscribed list. This will show you all groups you have previously selected. By unchecking the box next to a particular group, you can easily remove it from your active list. Because this list represents your personal choices, it is an excellent start page for your browser or should be bookmarked for convenient access. Don't forget to press the "Save Settings" button at the end of the page for your changes to take effect.

The final method is to use the results of a search to subscribe to newsgroups. For more information on searching, please take a look at our general search help page. The results of the search will be displayed similarly to View All Newsgroups above. You can then select or deselect those groups you wish to subscribe/unsubscribe to. Please press the "Save Settings" button at the end of the page to record changes.

 Personal News Settings: You can now set defaults for reading and posting to newsgroups with Personal News Settings. The first time you view this page there will be no selections. However, once you make any changes and press the "Save Settings" button, your current defaults will be loaded on future visits. Changes to your settings will take effect immediately and can be changed at any time.

Sort By: This option let's you select the method for sorting messages within a newsgroup.

Sorts newsgroup messages by discussion thread.

Sorts newsgroup messages by ascending date (oldest date first)

Sorts newsgroup messages by descending date (recent date first)

Sorts newsgroup messages alphabetically by Subject Line.

Sorts newsgroup messages alphabetically by Author's Name.

Collapse Binary List: This option will automatically group similar images (gif/jpeg) from a posting series, and collapse the entire series into one listing so that similar images are better organized within a newsgroup and display area can be conserved. As an example, if a person posted 5 different photos of their '68 Ford Mustang, the posts would usually appear in a newsgroup like this...

Rather than take up viewing space within a newsgroup, the "Collapse" feature will only display the title/subject line from the first post in an image series, and a secondary page will then be created to list all the other related images. These types of posts will appear with a "green plus" symbol next to them, as well as a number (5A for this example) which represents the number of available images within the posting series...

If you click on the "green plus" symbol, a secondary page will appear, which lists all the individual files that were posted within that series, and from that page the individual images can be downloaded or previewed. 

No Cross Posting: This field determines if you want to automatically cross post to the same groups that have been cross posted to in the original message you are replying to. If you check the box, your messages will only be posted in the group you are in when you respond to a post. If you do not check the box, your message will be posted in every group that the original message you are replying to was posted. As an example, if you are responding to a message you are viewing in the group alt.collecting.stamps.us, and the person who wrote the original message you are replying to cross posted the message to rec.collecting.stamps.discuss, if you checked the "No Cross Posting" Box, your reply would only appear in the alt.collecting.stamps.us group. It would not appear in the rec.collecting.stamps.discuss group that the original poster had cross posted to. Similarly, if you did not check the "No Cross Posting" box, your reply would appear in both groups just as the original poster's message.

In both cases, you can change the groups any of your messages (either replies to a message or a new thread you are creating) are cross-posted to by adding or deleting newsgroup names in the "Newsgroup" field of the posting form. If you are posting to more than one group, separate the group names by a comma and do not leave any blank spaces.

No X-Archive: When you select this option, your posts will not be stored in archive services.

Author's Name: Please enter your real name or a nickname. Whatever is entered here will show as "Author" when you view a list of messages within a newsgroup, and will be shown in parentheses following your return address once inside a message. As an example, if you were to enter "Fred Smith" in the author name, the name Fred Smith would appear in the author column when viewing a list of messages in a newsgroup as follows:

Return Address: Please enter your e-mail address in this box. This will be shown on the Author line once inside a message. Following the previous example, if Fred S were to enter "Fred@email.com" in the Return Address field, that information would appear within the messages that he posted to the newsgroups.

Please note how the Author name, entered in the previous example as "Fred S", appears in parentheses following the Return Address when viewing an actual message.

E-Mail Response Address: You can now cc: your posts to an e-mail address. Use this field to indicate your reply address on e-mails you send from the newsgroup. This address will not be shown in your post.

Attachments: Maximum Number of Lines: Direct Read News now allows you to
browse your local system for attachments. Simply click the "Browse" button and select a file name to attach to your post.

If you do not specify a maximum number of lines for each part of a multi-part post, the service will default to 7500 lines. The range for the number of lines is 1000 - 15000. 

If you forget to enter a file name within your subject line for the attachment, that information will automatically be inserted for you.. Additionally, if you
post a file which exceeds the default number of lines (7500) or the number of lines you specify in your preferences, your file/post will automatically be broken into the correct number of lines and parts.

If, for any reason, your post is not accepted and you get an on-screen message telling you to return to the post form to enter missing information, etc., please verify the attachment file name is still showing in the Attachment box. If it isn't showing, please click the Browse button again and re-select the filename.

Organization: You may elect to use the "Organization" details currently displayed within this settings field, or you may choose to modify it or leave this area blank.

Page Length: Enter the number of lines you would like to be displayed on a page. Entering 0 (zero) equals infinity. After changing any or all of these settings, do not forget to click the "Save Settings" button for the changes to take effect.

Opening Quote for Post: When you are replying to a post, you can customize the introduction of the previous poster's message using this field. Say something witty, silly or serious, whatever suits your needs. An example might be "On December 21, 1999 I recall say something like..."

Post Signature: A signature file is automatically added to the bottom of any message you posts to provide information about you. Some people put personal and/or work information, contact information or a favorite quote. 

Enter up to a maximum of 400 characters for your signature file. Please do not extend your line beyond 80 characters wide as it will wrap around when posted. Please limit your vertical lines to a maximum of 5.
